content: holder or piece of waste yarn the held stitches from the body of the sweater and the sleeve should line up with each other place 2nd marker continue knitting the next 35/ 39/ 43/ 47 stitches of the body this will be the back of the sweater place 3rd marker slip the next 6 stitches of the body onto a holder slip the second sleeve onto the circular needle knitting across 24/ 28/ 32/ 36 stitches of the sleeve and placing the last 6 stitches onto a stitch holder or piece of waste yarn as before the held stitches from the sleeve and the body should line up with each other place 4th marker you now have a total of 118/ 134/ 150/ 166 stitches on the circular needle it may feel crowded at first and if you dislike this you may move up to a 20 circular needle but this is not necessary you are now ready to knit the yoke of the sweater yoke knit in the round for 3 rounds on the 4th round knit until 3 stitches before the marker and begin the raglan decreases raglan decreases k2tog k1 pass marker k1 k2tog continue knitting across the front of the sweater until 3 stitches before the next marker and repeat the raglan decreases knit across the first sleeve until 3 stitches before the 3rd marker repeat raglan decreases and knit across the back of the sweater until 3 stitches before the 4th marker repeat raglan decrease and knit across the 2nd sleeve you are now back to the first stitch marker knit the next round repeat alternating one decrease round with one all-knit round until you have 44/ 48/ 52/ 56 stitches left switch to double pointed needles for knitting the neck and remove the stitch markers neck knit in the round for 7/ 8/ 9/ 10 rounds knit a loose-edge bind-off as follows loose-edge bind-off k1 *k1 pso k1 pso yo pso * repeat from * all the way around the neck knot and tie off finishing graft held stitches for the underarms as follows slip 6 stitches from sleeve onto one double pointed needle slip corresponding 6 stitches from body onto a 2nd double pointed needle hold them parallel to each other and using a piece of matching yarn about 6 long graft them together using kitchener stitch or 3-needle bind off or you may choose to bind off these 12 stitches and sew the seams together repeat for other arm stitch together gaps between the grafted stitch seams and the beginnings of the yoke roll up edges if they don t already roll by themselves some yarns need a little help rolling weave in all ends being careful to weave in the edge ends on the underside of the roll close to the edge so they will not show congratulations you ve finished your adorable baby sweater abbreviations co = cast on k = knit k2tog = knit two stitches together m1 =
